definitions.definition: An economic condition in which two sellers exert most control over the market of a commodity .
examples: Modern examples of duopoly include the American markets for credit cards ( Visa and MasterCard ), smartphones ( Apple and Google ), soft drinks ( Coca-Cola and Pepsi ), and airplanes ( Airbus and Boeing ).

subdefinitions.definition: The domination of a field of endeavour by two entities or people .
examples: First past the post voting has long maintained American politics as an effective duopoly where power simply alternates between two main parties.

subdefinitions.definition: A situation in which two or more radio or television stations in the same city or community share common ownership .

main_definition: ( economics ) An economic condition in which two sellers exert most control over the market of a commodity .
